page.title: 08RELIGION IN OSSINGTON (1)
page.content: The{18th century Church of the Holy {Rood}at{Ossington}is set in beautiful rural countryside. It is part of the {Worldwide Anglican Communion}and services are still held regularly every Sunday with an average congregation of fourteen. Looking at the Church register for the last{five {years}there have been{five baptisms, {three funerals}and{one wedding. The Church is part of the group of parishes of{Norwell, Ossington}and {Cromwell}formed into a{United Benefice in{1983.}This group in turn is part of the{Rural Deanery}of{Tuxford/Norwell which is part of{Southwell Diocese. There are six Church bells which are regularly rung by a team of local {campanologists.}The Church is reached by passing through a large iron gateway originally leading to {Ossington Hall, now demolished.
